description: Teleportation circle network template for world-building. DMs can define known circles and their sigil sequences to enable fast travel between locations.

spellReference.name: Teleportation Circle
spellReference.materialCost: 50 GP worth of rare chalks and inks infused with precious gems, which the spell consumes
spellReference.permanentCircleRequirement: Cast on the same spot every day for 1 year

knownCircles.name: Blackstaff Tower
knownCircles.notes: Heavily guarded. Permission required from the Blackstaff to use.

knownCircles.name: The Yawning Portal
knownCircles.notes: Available for a fee. Popular with adventurers.

knownCircles.name: Candlekeep
knownCircles.notes: Requires a book of value as entry fee. Circle in the inner ward.

knownCircles.name: Great Bazaar Portal
knownCircles.notes: One of many portals in Sigil. Requires a specific portal key.

knownCircles.name: Academy of Arcane Arts
knownCircles.notes: Available to members and paying customers.

accessLevels.name: Public
accessLevels.description: Open to anyone who knows the sigil sequence.

accessLevels.name: Semi-Public
accessLevels.description: Available for a fee or with basic credentials.

accessLevels.name: Restricted
accessLevels.description: Requires explicit permission from the controller.

accessLevels.name: Secret
accessLevels.description: Known only to a select few. Sigil sequence is closely guarded.

mishapTable.description: When using Teleport (not Teleportation Circle), the DM rolls on the Teleportation table based on familiarity.

familiarityLevels.notes: Teleportation Circle spell always succeeds to a known permanent circle.
Having an object from the destination guarantees success.
